com.gensym.message
Class Trace

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.gensym.message.Message
        |
        +--com.gensym.message.Trace
public class Trace
extends Message

Provides convenience methods for sending messages while tracing. NOTE: Do not generate garbage in the arguments to calls to send unless these calls are not made when tracing is off. The convenience send methods are provided to help avoid unnecessary garbage in complex tracing statements.

Since Tracing should not affect the normal operation of an application, the methods in this class will not throw exceptions.

The following shows a typical usage of this class.: 

 // DECLARATIONS:
 private static final Resource i18nTrace =
         Trace.getBundle("com.gensym.foo.TraceMessages");
 private static final MessageKey traceKey =
         Trace.registerMessageKey("com.gensym.foo", MyClass.class);
 ...
 // CALL IN CODE BODY
 Trace.send(5, traceKey, i18nTrace, "interestingThingHappened",
            arg1, arg2, arg3);
When adding tracing to your own application, it is necessary to add a MessageListener that will receive the Trace messages and print them out in whatever manner is appropriate for your application. A simple implemention of MessageListener can be seen in com.gensym.message.TraceOut.

See Also:
TraceOut

getBundle

public static Resource getBundle(String resourceName)
Provided as a wrapper around Resource.getBundle so that missing tracing resources cause no exceptions. If the requested Resource is missing, it returns a "dummy" Resource.
See Also:
Resource.getBundle(String), com.gensym.message.Resource#(boolean)

Provided as a wrapper around Resource.getBundle so that missing tracing resources cause no exceptions. If the requested Resource is missing, it returns a "dummy" Resource.
See Also:
Resource.getBundle(String, Locale), com.gensym.message.Resource#(boolean)

registerMessageKey

public static MessageKey registerMessageKey(String key,
                                            String otherKey)
for use in RMI packages where prohibitions on "Inner Classes" (i.e. use of MyClass.class) makes use of the other signatures difficult in a static initializer

registerMessageKey

public static MessageKey registerMessageKey(String key,
                                            Class classKey)
Creates a MessageKey to be used later in Trace.send() methods. MessageListeners can register interest in either the Class or the String, or both.
See Also:
Message.registerMessageKey(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class), com.gensym.message.Message#addMessageListener.

registerMessageKey

public static MessageKey registerMessageKey(String key,
                                            Class classKey,
                                            boolean internal)
Allow to specify whether the key is for internal tracing or for public consumption. NOTE: this is a proposed signature that currently ignores the third argument.

send

public static boolean send(int level,
                           MessageKey key,
                           Resource res,
                           String message,
                           Object[] args)
Send a tracing event if tracing is on. The remaining signatures of send are convenience methods that also allow for less generation of garbage.
Parameters:
level - the level of verbosity associated with this message.
key - the special key associated with this tracing method
res - the resource used to translate the message
message - the key for looking up the message in the given Resource
args - the arguments to be formatted into the message specified by message NOTE: the toString() method is called on the elements of this array if a message is to be sent.

exception

public static void exception(Throwable t,
                             String message)
Prints out the message, the t.getMessage(), t.printStackTrace() and a Thread.dumpStack(), to provide maximum debugging information. Only does these things when tracing is on
